intro: Spergularia colorata proles rupicola, commonly known as the rock sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a small, mat-forming plant characterized by its dense, low-growing habit and pale green to reddish stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. This species is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
